de.must.dataobj
Class ConnectionPool

java.lang.Object
  de.must.dataobj.ConnectionPool

public class ConnectionPool
extends java.lang.Object

Connection pool. More exactly it is a pool of connection holders. Provides reusage of temporarily private used connections.

See Also:
ConnectionHolder

Constructor Summary
ConnectionPool(ConnectionSpecification connectionSpecification)
          Constructs a new connection pool with a default capacity of 10 connections and a maximum size of 40 open connections.
ConnectionPool(ConnectionSpecification connectionSpecification, int baseCapacity)
          Constructs a new int array with the specified capacity with a maximum size of 40 open connections.

          Constructs a new int array with the specified capacity.

public int getMaxSize()
Return the maximum number of opened connections.

Returns:
the maximum number of opened connections

checkAndReactivateAllOpenConnections

public void checkAndReactivateAllOpenConnections()
Checks all open connections whether they are ok. If not, they are tried to be reactivated. (Once a night connections are often closed automatically.)

getPrivateConnectionHolder

public ConnectionHolder getPrivateConnectionHolder()
                                            throws ConnectionPoolExhaustedException
Returns a for private use locked connection holder.

Returns:
a for private use locked connection holder
Throws:
ConnectionPoolExhaustedException

Doubles the capacity of the ConnectionHolder array.

Returns:
the capacity increased array
